wiki_catalogs.name: Introduction
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the introduction section focused on the eagent repository. Explain its purpose as a CLI tool for automating Risk of Bias 2 (ROB2) assessment in clinical trial publications. Describe the core value proposition of using LangGraph-based agent workflows to streamline systematic review processes. Cover the primary use cases in research integrity evaluation and meta-analysis. Provide an overview of the technical architecture including the integration of Docling for PDF parsing, multiple retrieval strategies, evidence validation pipeline, and domain-specific reasoning. Highlight key features such as configurable validation modes, evidence fusion with RRF, and audit capabilities. Include practical examples of how researchers can use this tool to accelerate their workflow. Address the relationship between the CLI interface and potential API usage through the rob2_runner service. Document the project's maturity level based on milestone tracking and requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rule-Based Locator
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the rule-based evidence locator. Explain how predefined rules and patterns are used to identify relevant sections in clinical trial documents. Document the structure and syntax of the locator rules defined in locator_rules.yaml and implemented in locator_rules.py. Describe how the rule engine processes document sections and matches them against domain-specific criteria. Include examples of rule definitions for ROB2 domains and their corresponding matches. Explain integration with the LangGraph workflow via the rule_based.py node. Address configuration options, performance characteristics, and limitations. Provide guidance on extending and customizing rules for new domains or document structures. Discuss common issues such as rule conflicts and false positives, and how they are handled.

wiki_catalogs.name: Workflow Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the LangGraph workflow engine. Describe the high-level design of the StateGraph in rob2_graph.py, including node definitions, edge routing, and conditional logic. Explain the workflow sequence from document preprocessing through question planning, evidence location, fusion, validation, domain reasoning, and result aggregation. Document the state management approach using Rob2GraphState with over 200 fields tracking workflow progress. Illustrate the data flow and component interactions using system context diagrams from system-uml.md. Explain critical architectural decisions such as the retry mechanism for validation failures and conditional execution of audit steps. Address scalability considerations and performance optimization strategies. Include infrastructure requirements and deployment topology recommendations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Existence Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the existence validation sub-component. Thoroughly explain how the system verifies whether a cited piece of evidence actually exists within the provided document. Document the implementation details of the existence checker, including text span matching, context verification, and citation alignment. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how existence validation is invoked within the LangGraph workflow. Explain the interface between the pipeline node and the core validator, and describe the domain model for validation results. Address configuration options such as exact match thresholds and context window sizes. Provide usage patterns, common failure modes (e.g., truncated quotes, misaligned sections), and solutions. Include performance considerations when processing large documents and strategies for optimizing lookup speed.

wiki_catalogs.name: Run Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the 'run' command that executes the full ROB2 assessment workflow. Detail the command syntax: rob2 run <pdf_path> with all available options. Document each parameter including --options (JSON string for Rob2RunOptions), --options-file (path to JSON/YAML configuration), --set (key=value overrides), --debug (none|min|full levels), --include-reports, --include-audit-reports, --json, and --table. Explain the input requirements: valid PDF file path with existence and readability checks. Describe the output formats: JSON results via --json flag and Markdown tables via --table flag. Provide practical examples showing basic execution, configuration overrides, and debug mode usage. Document the integration with run_rob2 service function and Rob2Input/Rob2RunResult schemas. Include error handling for invalid PDFs, configuration errors, and processing failures. Address performance considerations for large PDFs and memory usage.

wiki_catalogs.name: D1: Randomization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the D1: Randomization domain reasoning component. Explain how the system evaluates the risk of bias related to randomization in clinical trials, including sequence generation and allocation concealment. Document the implementation in d1_randomization.py, focusing on how it integrates with the LangGraph workflow and consumes validated evidence from prior stages. Describe the structure and purpose of the D1-specific LLM prompt (d1_system.md), including key instructions, expected input format, and output parsing logic. Include configuration options such as LLM model, temperature, and retry behavior. Provide a concrete example of input evidence and corresponding reasoning output. Explain common failure modes, such as misinterpretation of randomization methods, and strategies to mitigate them. Address performance considerations when processing complex trial designs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Workflow State Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for Rob2GraphState, the central TypedDict that maintains the entire workflow state throughout the LangGraph execution. Detail each field including document metadata, question bank, evidence candidates, validation results, domain decisions, and audit trails. Explain how this state evolves through each node in the graph, with examples of state snapshots before and after key operations like retrieval, validation, and domain reasoning. Document type annotations, default values, and invariants that must be preserved. Illustrate with code examples how nodes read from and update the state, and how conditional routing depends on state values. Address performance considerations around state serialization and memory usage given the 200+ fields. Provide guidance on safely extending the state for custom nodes or debugging purposes.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Rob2GraphState TypedDict. Detail all 200+ fields organized into logical categories: document processing parameters, retrieval configuration, validation settings, domain reasoning models, audit controls, and workflow state tracking. Explain the role of each field in the workflow lifecycle, including how configuration propagates through nodes and how state evolves during execution. Document the use of Annotated types for state reduction (e.g., validation_retry_log, domain_audit_reports). Provide examples of state mutations at key workflow stages. Include guidance on how to extend the state schema for custom nodes while maintaining compatibility with the core workflow.

wiki_catalogs.name: Evidence Candidate Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the EvidenceCandidate model that represents retrieved evidence fragments within the system. Explain its structure including text content, source attribution (section, page, confidence score), and metadata fields. Document the validation rules and constraints applied to each field, such as text length limits and confidence score ranges. Illustrate how EvidenceCandidate instances are created during retrieval, modified during validation, and used in downstream reasoning. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing instantiation and manipulation. Explain the relationship between EvidenceCandidate and other entities like DocumentStructure and FusedEvidenceBundle. Address performance considerations such as memory footprint when handling large numbers of candidates and best practices for filtering and ranking. Include guidance on extending the model with custom metadata for specialized validation or domain requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the getting started section focused on initial user experience with the eagent tool. Explain the basic workflow from installation to executing the first ROB2 assessment. Provide step-by-step instructions for running the CLI command with a sample PDF path. Include examples of expected output formats including JSON results and Markdown tables. Explain the relationship between the architecture components shown in architecture.md and the user-facing interface described in interface_plan.md. Demonstrate common usage patterns such as basic assessment, configuration management, and debugging with the --debug flag. Address prerequisite knowledge including Python, command-line usage, and basic understanding of LLMs. Include troubleshooting tips for common initial setup issues. Highlight the learning progression from simple commands to more complex configurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: BM25 Retrieval
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the BM25 retrieval strategy. Explain how the BM25 algorithm is applied to retrieve relevant evidence from clinical trial documents. Document the implementation in bm25.py, including text preprocessing, indexing, and query execution. Describe integration with the LangGraph workflow through retrieval_bm25.py node. Cover configuration parameters such as k1, b, and tokenization settings. Include examples of retrieval results and performance metrics. Discuss trade-offs between speed and accuracy, and how BM25 complements other retrieval strategies. Provide guidance on tuning BM25 parameters for optimal performance in the ROB2 assessment context. Address common issues like vocabulary mismatch and how they are mitigated.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for Rob2GraphState. Detail the structure of this TypedDict that serves as the central state container for the LangGraph workflow. Document all key fields grouped by functional area: document processing (pdf_path, doc_structure), retrieval configuration (top_k, per_query_top_n, rrf_k), validation parameters (relevance_mode, existence_require_text_match, consistency_mode), domain reasoning models (d1_model, d2_model_provider, etc.), audit settings (domain_audit_mode, domain_audit_patch_window), and workflow tracking (validation_attempt, validation_retry_log). Explain how state evolves through the workflow lifecycle, including initialization in _init_validation_state_node and mutation patterns. Describe the role of Annotated types for list accumulation (operator.add) in domain_audit_reports and validation_retry_log. Provide examples of state snapshots at key workflow stages and explain best practices for accessing and modifying state within nodes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Relevance Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the relevance validation sub-component. Explain how the system determines whether retrieved evidence is contextually relevant to the question being assessed. Document the implementation using LLM-based classification with prompt engineering from domain_audit_system.md, including input formatting and decision criteria. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how relevance scores are generated and used in downstream decisions. Describe the integration with the validation pipeline and retry mechanisms when low relevance is detected. Explain configuration options such as relevance thresholds, LLM model selection, and prompt customization. Address common issues like false negatives due to paraphrasing or domain-specific jargon, and provide troubleshooting guidance. Include performance considerations regarding LLM latency and caching strategies for repeated queries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Config Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the 'config' command group that manages application configuration. Document subcommands for viewing, setting, and resetting configuration values. Explain the hierarchy of configuration sources: .env files, environment variables, and runtime overrides. Detail how configuration values map to Pydantic settings models in core/config.py. Include examples demonstrating how to inspect current settings, modify retrieval thresholds, adjust validation requirements, and configure LLM providers. Explain the relationship between CLI options and the Rob2RunOptions model. Provide guidance on configuration best practices and environment-specific setups. Address common issues like configuration precedence, invalid value types, and missing required settings.

wiki_catalogs.name: D2: Deviations from Intended Interventions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the D2: Deviations from Intended Interventions domain reasoning component. Explain how the system assesses bias arising from deviations in treatment protocols, non-adherence, and intervention modifications. Document the implementation in d2_deviations.py, detailing its role in the overall ROB2 workflow and interaction with the graph state. Describe the D2-specific LLM prompt (d2_system.md), including how it guides the model to identify and evaluate deviations, assess their impact, and determine direction of bias. Cover configuration parameters such as model selection and validation thresholds. Provide a practical example showing evidence input and reasoning output. Discuss accuracy challenges, such as distinguishing between minor and major deviations, and suggest tuning strategies. Include performance tips for handling large volumes of intervention data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Request Schemas
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for all request data models including Rob2Input, Rob2RunOptions, and configuration-related Pydantic models. Document field-by-field specifications for input parameters such as PDF paths, domain flags, validation thresholds, and LLM configuration. Explain the validation rules, default values, and environment variable bindings for each option. Provide practical examples of JSON payloads for different use cases including minimal configuration, full custom configuration, and edge cases. Illustrate how these request models are consumed by the CLI and service layer to initialize runs. Address common configuration errors and how to resolve them. Include guidance on extending request schemas for additional parameters while maintaining backward compatibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: Node Execution Sequence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the LangGraph node execution sequence. Explain the linear progression from preprocess through planner, evidence location (rule-based, BM25, SPLADE), fusion, and validation nodes. Document the conditional routing after completeness validation that either proceeds to domain reasoning or triggers a retry via prepare_retry. Describe the sequential domain reasoning flow (D1-D5) with audit nodes after each domain, and the final conditional edge to final_domain_audit. Illustrate the data flow between nodes using the Rob2GraphState. Provide code examples showing how nodes are registered in the StateGraph and how edge routing works. Include performance considerations for the linear sequence and error handling patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Structure Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the DocumentStructure model that represents parsed clinical trial documents. Cover its hierarchical organization including sections, subsections, and metadata such as title, authors, and publication information. Document the field types, validation constraints, and parsing logic from Docling output. Explain how this structure enables section-aware retrieval and evidence localization. Provide examples of DocumentStructure instances at different processing stages, from initial parsing to post-processed versions. Illustrate the relationship between DocumentStructure and LocatorResult, showing how evidence is positioned within the document hierarchy. Address performance implications of storing full document structures in memory and strategies for efficient traversal. Include guidance on extending the model to support additional document types or metadata fields for specialized analysis.

wiki_catalogs.name: Installation and Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the installation and setup section. Provide comprehensive instructions for installing the tool using uv or other Python package managers based on pyproject.toml configuration. Document the dependency requirements including LangGraph, Pydantic, Docling, and vector search libraries. Explain the configuration hierarchy with environment variables defined in .env.example. Include step-by-step setup instructions for configuring LLM providers, retrieval models, and optional components. Provide examples of how to set environment variables for different deployment scenarios. Document requirements for optional features like SPLADE model hosting or FAISS vector search. Include verification steps to confirm successful installation and configuration. Address common installation issues and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: SPLADE Retrieval
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the SPLADE retrieval strategy. Explain how SPLADE (SParse Lexical AnD Expansion) enhances retrieval by leveraging learned term expansions and sparse representations. Document the implementation in splade.py, including model loading, tokenization, and scoring mechanisms. Describe integration with the LangGraph workflow via the retrieval_splade.py node. Cover configuration options such as model selection, expansion thresholds, and scoring parameters. Include examples of how SPLADE identifies relevant evidence through semantic expansion. Discuss performance characteristics, memory requirements, and how SPLADE compares to BM25 in precision and recall. Provide guidance on when to use SPLADE over other retrieval methods and how to fine-tune its behavior for specific domains.

wiki_catalogs.name: Node Orchestration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the node orchestration mechanism in the ROB2 workflow. Thoroughly explain the implementation of build_rob2_graph function, including node registration via add_node, edge definition with add_edge, and conditional routing using add_conditional_edges. Document the node execution sequence from START to END, highlighting the linear progression through preprocessing, planning, evidence location, fusion, and validation. Explain the role of special internal nodes like init_validation and prepare_retry in managing workflow state. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how node overrides are handled through the node_overrides parameter. Address the recursion limit configuration (100) and its necessity due to the retry loop. Provide guidance on extending the graph with new nodes and modifying execution paths.

wiki_catalogs.name: Consistency Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the consistency validation sub-component. Explain how the system evaluates whether multiple pieces of evidence for the same question are logically consistent with one another. Document the implementation that compares assertions across evidence candidates using semantic similarity and contradiction detection techniques. Include examples from the codebase showing how consistency checks are performed within the validation pipeline. Describe the role of LLM prompts in identifying contradictions and how results are aggregated. Explain configuration options such as contradiction thresholds and handling of partial agreements. Address common issues like apparent inconsistencies due to temporal progression in trial reporting, and provide resolution strategies. Include performance considerations when comparing large sets of evidence and optimization through early termination.

wiki_catalogs.name: Validate Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the 'validate' command that tests evidence validation components. Document subcommands for testing existence, relevance, consistency, and completeness validators. Explain the input requirements: test evidence bundles and reference contexts. Describe the validation output format showing pass/fail results and confidence scores. Provide examples demonstrating how to validate evidence for specific ROB2 domains and question types. Detail the integration with validator classes in evidence/validators/ module and their configuration parameters. Include guidance on interpreting validation reports and troubleshooting failed validations. Address performance considerations when running batch validation tests and memory usage for large evidence sets.

wiki_catalogs.name: D3: Missing Outcome Data
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the D3: Missing Outcome Data domain reasoning component. Explain how the system evaluates the risk of bias due to incomplete outcome reporting, participant dropout, and missing data handling methods. Document the implementation in d3_missing_data.py, focusing on its integration with the evidence validation pipeline and state management in LangGraph. Describe the structure and logic of the D3-specific LLM prompt (d3_system.md), including how it directs the model to assess attrition rates, reasons for missingness, and statistical handling methods. Include configuration options for sensitivity analysis and threshold settings. Provide a real-world example of input evidence and resulting reasoning output. Address common issues such as ambiguous reporting of dropout rates and suggest mitigation approaches. Discuss performance optimization for longitudinal studies with complex missing data patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Response Schemas
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the response data models that define the final output structure of the ROB2 assessment. Detail Rob2FinalOutput and its nested components including domain assessments, evidence bundles, confidence scores, and audit metadata. Document the schema for structured outputs in both JSON and Markdown formats. Explain how intermediate results are transformed into the final response, including aggregation logic and risk judgment formulation. Provide sample responses for different assessment outcomes and edge cases. Address schema versioning considerations and backward compatibility for API consumers. Include guidance on parsing and post-processing the output for integration with downstream systems like systematic review databases or visualization tools.

wiki_catalogs.name: Conditional Routing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the conditional routing system in the ROB2 workflow. Detail the validation_should_retry function that evaluates validation_attempt, validation_max_retries, completeness_passed, and consistency_failed_questions to determine whether to retry evidence location or proceed to domain reasoning. Explain the domain_audit_should_run_final condition that controls execution of the final_domain_audit node. Document the retry mechanism's state modification strategy in _prepare_validation_retry_node, including parameter relaxation (disabling structure awareness, increasing top-k values) on subsequent attempts. Provide examples of how these routing decisions impact workflow behavior and output quality. Include troubleshooting guidance for routing-related issues and testing strategies for conditional logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Locator Result Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the LocatorResult model that represents the positioning and provenance of evidence within source documents. Explain its components including section paths, page numbers, paragraph indices, and confidence metrics. Document how LocatorResult is generated by different locator strategies (rule-based, BM25, SPLADE) and used in evidence fusion. Describe the validation rules and data integrity constraints applied to location data. Provide examples showing LocatorResult instances from various retrieval methods and their role in audit trails. Illustrate the relationship between LocatorResult, EvidenceCandidate, and DocumentStructure, emphasizing traceability requirements for systematic reviews. Address performance considerations in storing and querying large volumes of location data, and best practices for normalization and indexing. Include guidance on extending the model to support additional locator types or enhanced provenance tracking.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Concepts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the core concepts section focused on fundamental architectural principles. Explain the LangGraph workflow orchestration pattern used to manage the ROB2 assessment pipeline. Describe the state machine design with Rob2GraphState maintaining context across processing stages. Detail the component interaction model where nodes perform specific tasks like retrieval, validation, and reasoning. Illustrate data flow through the system using diagrams from system-uml.md. Explain key concepts including evidence validation pipeline stages, retrieval fusion techniques (RRF), and domain reasoning for ROB2's five domains. Cover the validation retry mechanism and its role in ensuring assessment quality. Include practical examples showing how these concepts manifest in the actual workflow. Address performance considerations and optimization opportunities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Full-Text Locator
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the full-text evidence locator. Explain how LLM-powered query planning and dense retrieval are used to locate evidence across the entire document. Document the integration of query planning via planner.py and LLM-based query expansion. Describe the use of FAISS with inner product (faiss_ip.py) for efficient similarity search over dense embeddings. Explain how the system generates and executes semantic queries to find relevant passages that may not match lexically. Include examples of query generation and retrieval results. Discuss configuration options for LLM selection, embedding models, and retrieval thresholds. Address performance considerations, latency implications, and cost trade-offs. Provide guidance on when to enable full-text search and how it complements sparse retrieval methods like BM25 and SPLADE.

wiki_catalogs.name: Conditional Routing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the conditional routing system in the ROB2 workflow. Thoroughly explain the implementation and usage of validation_should_retry and domain_audit_should_run_final functions imported from routing.py. Document how these functions evaluate the current state to determine workflow progression - specifically how validation failures trigger retry loops and how final audit steps are conditionally executed. Explain the return value mappings (e.g., {'retry': 'prepare_retry', 'proceed': 'd1_randomization'}) and their impact on workflow execution. Include examples from the codebase showing the integration of these routing functions with add_conditional_edges. Address common issues such as infinite retry loops and incorrect audit triggering, providing solutions and best practices for configuring retry thresholds and audit conditions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Completeness Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the completeness validation sub-component. Explain how the system assesses whether the collected evidence sufficiently addresses all aspects of a given ROB2 question. Document the implementation that uses domain-specific rules and LLM reasoning to identify missing information. Include examples from the codebase showing how completeness checks are integrated into the validation pipeline and how they trigger evidence patching or additional retrieval. Describe the interaction with the domain audit module and the use of domain_audit_system.md prompts. Explain configuration options such as relaxation modes, required evidence types, and tolerance levels. Address common issues like incomplete reporting in source documents and provide mitigation strategies. Include performance considerations regarding recursive validation attempts and resource usage.

wiki_catalogs.name: Retrieval Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the 'retrieval' command group that tests evidence retrieval components. Document subcommands for BM25, SPLADE, and rule-based retrieval strategies. Explain the input parameters: query text, document context, and retrieval configuration. Describe the output format showing retrieved evidence snippets with scores and source locations. Provide examples comparing results across different retrieval engines and demonstrating hybrid retrieval approaches. Detail the integration with retrieval engines in retrieval/engines/ module and their configuration options. Include guidance on interpreting retrieval scores, adjusting similarity thresholds, and optimizing query performance. Address common issues like low recall, irrelevant results, and engine-specific limitations.

wiki_catalogs.name: D4: Measurement of the Outcome
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the D4: Measurement of the Outcome domain reasoning component. Explain how the system assesses bias related to outcome assessment methods, blinding, and measurement tools. Document the implementation in d4_measurement.py, detailing its role in analyzing outcome-specific evidence and generating domain judgments. Describe the D4-specific LLM prompt (d4_system.md), including how it structures the reasoning process around blinding procedures, objective vs. subjective outcomes, and potential measurement bias. Cover configuration parameters such as model temperature and validation rules. Provide a concrete example showing evidence input and reasoning output for both objective and subjective outcomes. Discuss accuracy considerations, such as detecting inadequate blinding descriptions, and suggest prompt engineering improvements. Include performance guidance for handling multiple outcome measures efficiently.

wiki_catalogs.name: Internal Data Entities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the internal data entity models that represent domain-specific concepts within the system. Cover EvidenceCandidate with its source attribution and confidence scoring, DocumentStructure with section hierarchy and metadata, LocatorResult for evidence positioning, and DecisionRecord for domain judgments. Explain the relationships between these entities and how they flow through the pipeline. Document field semantics, validation constraints, and business rules governing their use. Provide examples of entity instances at different processing stages. Address performance implications of entity design choices, such as denormalization for faster access versus storage efficiency. Include guidance on extending these models for additional metadata or custom processing requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Retry and Rollback Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the validation retry and rollback mechanism. Explain how the workflow implements automatic rollback to evidence location when validation fails, using the prepare_retry node to modify configuration parameters for subsequent attempts. Document the progressive relaxation strategy: disabling structure-aware retrieval on first retry, doubling per_query_top_n, increasing top_k, and relaxing validation requirements (relevance_min_confidence, existence checks). Describe the recursion limit configuration (100) necessary to support deep retry loops. Include the validation_retry_log structure that tracks each retry attempt's parameters and outcomes. Provide practical examples of when retries are triggered and how they improve evidence quality. Address common issues like infinite retry loops and performance impacts of multiple attempts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Decision Record Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the DecisionRecord model that captures domain-level judgments in the ROB2 assessment process. Cover its structure including domain identifier, risk judgment (low, high, some concerns), rationale, supporting evidence references, and confidence levels. Document the validation rules and business logic constraints that ensure assessment integrity. Explain how DecisionRecord instances are created during domain reasoning and aggregated into final assessments. Provide examples from each ROB2 domain (D1-D5) showing different decision patterns and rationales. Illustrate the relationship between DecisionRecord, EvidenceCandidate, and Rob2FinalOutput, emphasizing auditability requirements. Address performance considerations in storing decision provenance and strategies for efficient retrieval during reporting. Include guidance on extending the model to support additional decision metadata or custom risk categories.

wiki_catalogs.name: Command Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the CLI command interface. Document all available commands including run, config, cache, validate, retrieval, fusion, graph, locator, questions, and playground. For each command, specify the command syntax, parameters, options, and return values. Include examples demonstrating common usage patterns for each command. Explain the relationship between the Typer-based CLI in app.py and the individual command modules. Document the input/output formats for each command, including JSON input requirements and output structures. Address error handling and exit codes. Provide guidance on combining commands for advanced workflows. Include performance considerations and best practices for command usage.

wiki_catalogs.name: Retry Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the validation retry mechanism in the ROB2 workflow. Thoroughly explain the implementation of _init_validation_state_node and _prepare_validation_retry_node functions that manage retry state and configuration adjustments. Document the complete retry cycle: from validation failure detection in completeness_validator_node, through conditional routing to 'retry', execution of prepare_retry node, and rollback to evidence location phase. Explain the progressive relaxation strategy including disabling structure-aware retrieval on first retry, increasing per_query_top_n and top_k values, and relaxing validation requirements when validation_relax_on_retry is enabled. Detail the configuration parameters controlling retries (validation_max_retries, validation_relax_on_retry) and the logging mechanism via validation_retry_log. Provide examples of retry scenarios and best practices for tuning retry behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Validation Retry Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the validation retry mechanism. Explain how the system handles failed validation checks by triggering targeted retries with adjusted parameters or alternative evidence sources. Document the implementation within the LangGraph state machine, including conditional routing based on validation outcomes. Include examples from the codebase showing how retry logic is defined in rob2_graph.py and how routing decisions are made. Describe the interaction between validation nodes and the planner/fusion components during retries. Explain configuration options such as maximum retry attempts, backoff strategies, and conditions for escalation. Address common issues like infinite retry loops or diminishing returns, and provide troubleshooting guidance. Include performance considerations regarding overall workflow duration and resource consumption during retries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Fusion Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the 'fusion' command that tests evidence fusion strategies. Document the command syntax for combining results from multiple retrieval engines using Rank Fusion (RRF) and weighted scoring. Explain input requirements: multiple evidence result sets from different retrieval strategies. Describe the output format showing fused evidence rankings with combined scores. Provide examples demonstrating fusion effectiveness compared to individual retrieval methods. Detail the implementation of fusion algorithms in evidence/fusion.py and their configuration parameters. Include guidance on tuning fusion weights, evaluating fusion quality, and troubleshooting ranking inconsistencies. Address performance considerations for large result sets and memory usage during fusion operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: D5: Selection of the Reported Result
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the D5: Selection of the Reported Result domain reasoning component. Explain how the system evaluates bias arising from selective outcome reporting, data dredging, and result manipulation. Document the implementation in d5_reporting.py, focusing on its analysis of statistical reporting patterns and comparison against study protocols. Describe the D5-specific LLM prompt (d5_system.md), including how it guides the model to detect inconsistencies between planned and reported outcomes, assess statistical significance filtering, and evaluate multiplicity adjustments. Include configuration options for statistical threshold detection and reporting completeness checks. Provide a practical example with input evidence and reasoning output highlighting selective reporting. Address common challenges such as incomplete protocol availability and suggest workarounds. Discuss performance considerations when analyzing large numbers of reported results and statistical tests.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the configuration guide focused on the application's settings system. Explain the Pydantic-based configuration model in core/config.py and its integration with environment variables from .env.example. Document all configurable parameters including preprocessing options, retrieval settings, validation thresholds, domain reasoning configurations, and output controls. Describe the configuration hierarchy with defaults, environment variables, and runtime overrides. Provide examples of configuration files for different use cases. Explain how configuration values flow through the system from CLI to service layer to individual components. Include best practices for managing sensitive credentials and optimizing performance through configuration. Address common configuration issues and debugging techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Graph Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the 'graph' command that inspects and debugs the LangGraph workflow. Document subcommands for visualizing the workflow graph, checking node connections, and tracing execution paths. Explain the output formats: graph structure descriptions and execution traces. Provide examples showing how to visualize the complete ROB2 assessment workflow and debug specific processing stages. Detail the integration with LangGraph components in pipelines/graphs/ module and state management patterns. Include guidance on interpreting graph topology, identifying bottlenecks, and understanding state transitions. Address common issues like circular dependencies, missing node connections, and state corruption during workflow execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Workflow Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the LangGraph workflow engine. Describe the high-level design of the StateGraph in rob2_graph.py, including node definitions, edge routing, and conditional logic. Explain the workflow sequence from document preprocessing through question planning, evidence location, fusion, validation, domain reasoning, and result aggregation. Document the state management approach using Rob2GraphState with over 200 fields tracking workflow progress. Illustrate the data flow and component interactions using system context diagrams from system-uml.md. Explain critical architectural decisions such as the retry mechanism for validation failures and conditional execution of audit steps. Address scalability considerations and performance optimization strategies. Include infrastructure requirements and deployment topology recommendations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Locator Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the 'locator' command that tests evidence location strategies. Document subcommands for rule-based, BM25, and SPLADE locators. Explain input parameters: target questions and document contexts. Describe the output format showing located evidence with confidence scores and positional information. Provide examples demonstrating how different locators perform on various ROB2 assessment questions. Detail the implementation of locator rules in rob2/locator_rules.py and their pattern matching logic. Include guidance on creating custom locator rules, evaluating locator accuracy, and troubleshooting false positives/negatives. Address performance considerations for rule compilation and matching efficiency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the document processing sub-feature. Explain the PDF parsing pipeline using Docling for layout analysis and content extraction. Describe the document structure representation and how it's used throughout the workflow. Document configuration options for Docling models and processing parameters in core/config.py. Include examples of input/output formats for document processing. Explain how the parsed document structure enables downstream tasks like evidence location and validation. Address performance considerations for processing large PDFs and handling complex layouts. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common document parsing issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Questions Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the 'questions' command that manages ROB2 assessment questions. Document subcommands for listing available questions, filtering by domain, and generating question sets. Explain the question bank structure in rob2/question_bank.py and domain categorization. Describe the output format showing question texts, domains, and metadata. Provide examples demonstrating how to generate domain-specific question sets and customize question selection. Detail the integration with question planning components in pipelines/graphs/nodes/planner.py. Include guidance on extending the question bank, creating custom question sets, and mapping questions to evidence requirements. Address common issues like missing questions, incorrect domain mappings, and question duplication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Question Planning
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the question planning sub-feature. Explain the process of generating ROB2 assessment questions from the question bank in rob2/question_bank.py. Describe the deterministic and LLM-based query planning strategies. Document the planner node's role in mapping high-level assessment goals to specific evidence retrieval queries. Include examples of question generation for different clinical trial types. Explain how the planner adapts to document content and user configuration. Address performance considerations for query planning and optimization techniques. Provide guidance on extending the question bank for specialized domains.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the 'audit' command that performs domain-level evidence audits. Document the command syntax for executing audit checks and generating audit reports. Explain input requirements: validated evidence sets and domain contexts. Describe the output format showing audit findings, evidence gaps, and patching recommendations. Provide examples demonstrating how to run audits for specific domains and interpret audit results. Detail the implementation of audit logic in domain_audit.py and the LLM prompt templates used for evidence gap analysis. Include guidance on configuring audit strictness, interpreting audit confidence scores, and applying evidence patches. Address common issues like false audit findings, missing evidence patches, and inconsistent audit results.

wiki_catalogs.name: Evidence Location
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the evidence location system. Explain the multi-strategy approach to finding relevant evidence in clinical trial documents. Cover the integration of rule-based, BM25, SPLADE, and full-text retrieval methods. Describe how different locator strategies complement each other in finding evidence. Document the configuration options for each retrieval engine and their performance characteristics. Include examples of retrieval results from different strategies. Address accuracy considerations and trade-offs between precision and recall. Provide guidance on selecting and tuning retrieval strategies for specific use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Cache Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the 'cache' command that manages application caching. Document subcommands for clearing, inspecting, and configuring the cache. Explain the cache structure and storage locations for processed PDFs, retrieval results, and intermediate workflow states. Describe the impact of cache operations on performance and disk usage. Provide examples showing how to clear specific cache entries, inspect cache contents, and optimize cache size. Detail the integration with IO services in services/io.py and cache invalidation strategies. Include guidance on cache maintenance, storage requirements, and performance optimization through caching. Address common issues like cache corruption, excessive disk usage, and stale cache entries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Evidence Fusion
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the evidence fusion sub-feature. Explain the rank fusion process using Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) to combine results from multiple retrieval strategies. Describe the fusion node's implementation and its role in the workflow. Document configuration options for fusion parameters including top_k, rrf_k, and engine weights. Include examples of fusion results showing how different retrieval methods contribute to the final candidate set. Explain the impact of fusion on retrieval accuracy and robustness. Address performance considerations for fusion operations and optimization techniques. Provide guidance on tuning fusion parameters for optimal results.

wiki_catalogs.name: Playground Command
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the 'playground' command that provides an interactive environment for testing components. Document subcommands for accessing different playground environments, particularly for D1 randomization assessment. Explain the interactive features: real-time feedback, component testing, and parameter tuning. Describe the use cases for rapid prototyping and debugging specific workflow stages. Provide examples demonstrating how to test evidence validation, retrieval strategies, and domain reasoning in isolation. Detail the implementation in playground/ modules and their relationship to production components. Include guidance on effective playground usage, experiment design, and transferring playground findings to production configurations. Address limitations of the playground environment compared to full workflow execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Evidence Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the evidence validation pipeline. Explain the multi-stage validation process that ensures evidence quality before domain reasoning. Cover the four validation types: existence, relevance, consistency, and completeness. Describe the validation workflow and retry mechanism for handling validation failures. Document configuration options for validation thresholds and requirements. Include examples of validation reports and their interpretation. Explain how validation results influence downstream decisions. Address performance considerations for validation operations and strategies for improving validation accuracy. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common validation issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Domain Reasoning
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the domain reasoning system. Explain the specialized reasoning process for each of ROB2's five domains: randomization, deviations, missing data, measurement, and reporting. Describe how domain-specific prompts in llm/prompts/domains/ guide the LLM-based reasoning process. Document the configuration options for domain reasoning including model selection, temperature, and retry settings. Include examples of reasoning outputs for different domains. Explain how validated evidence is used as input to domain reasoning. Address accuracy considerations and strategies for improving reasoning quality. Provide guidance on customizing domain reasoning for specific research needs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Domain Audit
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the domain audit sub-feature. Explain the audit process that verifies and potentially corrects domain-level decisions. Describe the LLM-based audit mechanism and its configuration options. Document the audit workflow including patching evidence and optional re-running of domain reasoning. Include examples of audit reports and their impact on final assessments. Explain how audit results contribute to assessment reliability. Address performance considerations for audit operations and strategies for optimizing audit effectiveness. Provide guidance on when to enable audit mode for different use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Result Aggregation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the result aggregation sub-feature. Explain the process of combining domain-level decisions into an overall risk of bias assessment. Describe the aggregation node's implementation and its role in the final workflow stage. Document the output formats including structured JSON results and Markdown tables. Include examples of aggregated results and their interpretation. Explain how confidence levels and supporting evidence are summarized. Address accuracy considerations for aggregation and strategies for improving result clarity. Provide guidance on customizing output formats for different reporting needs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models and Schemas
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the application's data structures. Detail the Rob2GraphState TypedDict with its 200+ fields that maintain workflow state. Document the request and response schemas in src/schemas/ including Rob2Input, Rob2RunOptions, and Rob2RunResult. Explain the entity relationships between different data models and their role in the workflow. Include field definitions, data types, validation rules, and business logic. Provide examples of data payloads at different workflow stages. Address data lifecycle considerations and performance implications of the data model design. Include guidance on extending the schemas for custom use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Advanced Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for advanced configuration options. Explain the Rob2RunOptions model in requests.py and its relationship to the core configuration system. Document advanced settings for fine-tuning workflow behavior including validation retry policies, fusion weights, and domain-specific parameters. Describe the configuration override hierarchy from defaults to environment variables to runtime options. Provide examples of configuration profiles for different assessment scenarios. Explain how advanced configuration affects system performance and accuracy. Include best practices for managing complex configurations and avoiding common pitfalls. Address security considerations for sensitive configuration options.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for developers contributing to the project. Explain the testing strategy with unit and integration tests in the tests/ directory. Document the utility scripts in scripts/ for component verification and debugging. Describe the development workflow including coding standards, testing practices, and contribution guidelines. Provide examples of how to write tests for new features and verify existing functionality. Explain the debugging tools and techniques available for troubleshooting issues. Address performance testing and optimization strategies. Include guidance on extending the system with new features or integrations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive troubleshooting content based on known issues and architectural decisions. Address common problems users encounter during installation, configuration, and execution. Document error patterns and their root causes based on the ADRs in docs/adr/. Provide diagnostic steps for identifying issues in different workflow stages. Include solutions for common problems such as retrieval failures, validation errors, and LLM connectivity issues. Explain how to interpret error messages and logs. Address performance bottlenecks and resource constraints. Provide workarounds for known limitations documented in Milestones.md. Include escalation paths for unresolved issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: FAQ
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive FAQ content addressing common user questions. Cover topics such as system requirements, installation issues, configuration questions, and usage patterns. Include questions about the differences between retrieval methods, validation settings, and domain reasoning approaches. Address questions about performance expectations and resource requirements. Document frequently asked questions about output interpretation and result reliability. Provide answers based on the project's requirements and milestone tracking. Include questions about extensibility and customization options. Address common misconceptions about the tool's capabilities and limitations.

wiki_items.title: D5: Selection of the Reported Result

wiki_overview.content:
# Comprehensive Project Overview: eagent ## 1. Project Introduction ### Purpose Statement The **eagent** project is a production-ready LangGraph-based agent system designed to automate the Risk of Bias 2 (ROB2) assessment process for clinical trial publications. It systematically evaluates research papers for potential biases across five domains (randomization, deviations, missing data, outcome measurement, and selective reporting) using a combination of retrieval, validation, and reasoning components. ### Core Goals and Objectives - Automate the ROB2 assessment workflow from PDF input to structured output - Implement a robust evidence retrieval and validation pipeline - Provide configurable LLM-based reasoning for domain-specific risk assessment - Support both CLI and potential API interfaces with shared core services - Enable reproducible and auditable bias assessments with detailed reporting ### Target Audience - Systematic review researchers and meta-analysts - Evidence-based medicine practitioners - Research integrity evaluators - Developers building automated research assessment tools ## 2. Technical Architecture ### Component Breakdown The system follows a layered architecture with clear separation of concerns, organized into distinct subsystems: ```mermaid flowchart TD subgraph Inputs A[Paper PDF] end subgraph Preprocessing C[Docling Parser] D[Structured Doc JSON
body, sections, spans] end subgraph Planning E[Domain Question Planner
Standard ROB2] F[Question Schema + Decision Trees] end subgraph EvidenceLocation[Evidence Location Layer] G1[FullText Locator LLM] G2[Rule-Based Locator] G3[Retrieval Engine
BM25/Dense/SPLADE] end subgraph EvidenceFusion H[Evidence Fusion Agent] end subgraph Validation I1[Existence Validator] I2[Relevance Validator] I3[Consistency Validator] I4[Completeness Validator] end subgraph Reasoning J1[D1 Randomization] J2[D2 Deviations] J3[D3 Missing Data] J4[D4 Outcome Measurement] J5[D5 Selective Reporting] end subgraph Audit K[Per-domain Full-Text Audit
patch evidence + rerun] end subgraph Aggregation L[ROB2 Aggregator] end subgraph Outputs M[Report Table + JSON
Evidence citations] end A --> C C --> D D --> E D --> G1 D --> G2 D --> G3 F --> E F --> J1 F --> J2 F --> J3 F --> J4 F --> J5 E --> G1 E --> G2 E --> G3 G1 --> H G2 --> H G3 --> H H --> I1 --> I2 --> I3 --> I4 I4 -->|pass| J1 I4 -->|pass| J2 I4 -->|pass| J3 I4 -->|pass| J4 I4 -->|pass| J5 I4 -->|fail| G1 I4 -->|fail| G2 I4 -->|fail| G3 J1 --> K J2 --> K J3 --> K J4 --> K J5 --> K K --> L --> M ``` ### Design Patterns The architecture follows several key design patterns: - **State Machine Pattern**: Using LangGraph to manage the workflow state transitions - **Dependency Injection**: Configuration and services are injected through settings - **Strategy Pattern**: Multiple retrieval engines (BM25, SPLADE, rule-based) - **Validation Pipeline**: Sequential validation with retry mechanisms - **Layered Architecture**: Clear separation between infrastructure, domain logic, and presentation ### Data Flow The data flows through the system in a well-defined sequence: ```mermaid flowchart TD A[PDF Input] --> B[Document Parsing] B --> C[Question Planning] C --> D[Evidence Location] D --> E[Evidence Fusion] E --> F[Existence Validation] F --> G[Relevance Validation] G --> H[Consistency Validation] H --> I[Completeness Validation] I --> J{Valid?} J -->|Yes| K[Domain Reasoning] J -->|No| D K --> L[Domain Audit] L --> M[Aggregation] M --> N[Structured Output] ``` ## 3. Key Implementation ### Main Entry Points - **CLI Application**: `src/cli/app.py` - Typer-based command-line interface - **Core Service**: `src/services/rob2_runner.py` - Shared service layer for CLI and potential API - **Graph Definition**: `src/pipelines/graphs/rob2_graph.py` - LangGraph workflow definition Sources: - [app.py](src/cli/app.py) - [rob2_runner.py](src/services/rob2_runner.py) - [rob2_graph.py](src/pipelines/graphs/rob2_graph.py) ### Core Modules - **Configuration Management**: `src/core/config.py` - Pydantic settings with environment variable binding - **Evidence Validation**: `src/evidence/validators/` - Comprehensive validation pipeline - **Domain Reasoning**: `src/pipelines/graphs/nodes/domains/` - Domain-specific risk assessment - **Retrieval Engines**: `src/retrieval/engines/` - Multiple retrieval strategies Sources: - [config.py](src/core/config.py) - [validators](src/evidence/validators/) - [domains](src/pipelines/graphs/nodes/domains/) - [engines](src/retrieval/engines/) ### Configuration Approach The system uses a hierarchical configuration approach with multiple override levels: ```mermaid graph TD A[Default Values] --> B[.env File] B --> C[Environment Variables] C --> D[CLI/API Parameters] D --> E[Runtime Overrides] ``` The configuration is managed through Pydantic's `BaseSettings` with environment variable aliases, allowing for flexible deployment across different environments. Sources: - [config.py](src/core/config.py) - [.env.example](.env.example) ### External Dependencies Key external dependencies include: - **LangChain Ecosystem**: `langchain`, `langgraph`, `langsmith` for agent orchestration - **LLM Integration**: Support for multiple providers through `langchain-openai`, `langchain-anthropic` - **Document Processing**: `docling` for PDF parsing and structure extraction - **Retrieval**: `faiss-cpu` for vector similarity search - **Configuration**: `pydantic-settings` for typed configuration management Sources: - [pyproject.toml](pyproject.toml) ### Integration Points The system integrates with various external services and components: ```mermaid graph LR A[Local File System] --> B[eagent] C[Hugging Face Models] --> B D[OpenAI API] --> B E[Anthropic API] --> B F[PDF Documents] --> B B --> G[Structured Output] B --> H[JSON Reports] B --> I[Markdown Tables] ``` ## 4. Key Features ### Functionality Overview The system provides comprehensive ROB2 assessment capabilities: - Automated PDF parsing and document structure extraction - Multi-strategy evidence retrieval (rule-based, keyword, semantic) - Evidence validation with configurable thresholds - Domain-specific risk assessment using LLM reasoning - Configurable audit and evidence patching - Detailed reporting with citation tracking ### Implementation Highlights The system implements several sophisticated features: ```mermaid stateDiagram-v2 [*] --> Preprocessing Preprocessing --> Planning Planning --> EvidenceLocation EvidenceLocation --> Fusion Fusion --> ExistenceValidation ExistenceValidation --> RelevanceValidation RelevanceValidation --> ConsistencyValidation ConsistencyValidation --> CompletenessValidation CompletenessValidation --> ValidationDecision ValidationDecision --> Retry: Failed ValidationDecision --> DomainReasoning: Passed Retry --> EvidenceLocation DomainReasoning --> Audit Audit --> Aggregation Aggregation --> Output Output --> [*] ``` Key implementation aspects include: - **Retry Mechanism**: The validation pipeline supports configurable retries with progressive relaxation of criteria - **Evidence Fusion**: Multiple retrieval results are combined using rank fusion techniques - **Configurable Validation**: Each validation step has configurable parameters for confidence thresholds and requirements - **Domain-Specific Reasoning**: Each ROB2 domain has dedicated reasoning logic with rule-based risk assessment Sources: - [rob2_graph.py](src/pipelines/graphs/rob2_graph.py) - [relevance.py](src/evidence/validators/relevance.py) - [decision_rules.py](src/rob2/decision_rules.py) - [fusion.py](src/retrieval/engines/fusion.py) ### Component Relationships The relationships between key components are well-defined and modular: ```mermaid graph LR A[CLI] --> B[rob2_runner] C[API] --> B B --> D[rob2_graph] D --> E[Preprocessing] D --> F[Planning] D --> G[Retrieval] D --> H[Validation] D --> I[Reasoning] D --> J[Audit] D --> K[Aggregation] E --> L[Docling] G --> M[BM25] G --> N[SPLADE] G --> O[Rule-Based] H --> P[Existence] H --> Q[Relevance] H --> R[Consistency] H --> S[Completeness] I --> T[D1-D5] T --> U[decision_rules] K --> V[Output] ``` This modular design allows for independent development and testing of components while maintaining a cohesive workflow.
